It seems you have a cold
It seems you have a cold, make sure you stay hydrated

patterns: I am more thirsty than usual
I am having a lot of infections
responses: You might have diabetes, here is more information https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/diabetes/, see your GP as soon as possible

patterns: I have a shortness of breath
I have pain in my neck
There is a numbness in my legs
responses: You might have heart disease, here is more information https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronary-heart-disease/, see your GP as soon as possible

patterns: I have had a cough for a long time
I have a shortness of breath
I have had mucus for a long time
responses: You might have lung disease or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), here is more information https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/chronic-obstructive-pulmonary-disease-copd/

patterns: I have had a cough for a long time
I have a fever at night
I have s sore that has not healed
responses: It is possible you might have a form of cancer, here is more information https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/cancer/, please see your GP as soon as possible

patterns: I would like to meet with a doctor
responses: Ok, please follow this link to communicate with a doctor https://www.nhs.uk/nhs-app/nhs-app-help-and-support/appointments-and-online-consultations-in-the-nhs-app/online-consultations/

patterns: What are the details to communicate with my GP
responses: Every GP has a different contact information, to find the details for your GP follow this link https://www.nhs.uk/contact-us/find-contact-details-gps-hospitals-and-other-services/
